Name: Requiring the police department to report on traffic encounters.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the police department to report on traffic encounters
Summary: This bill would require the New York City Police Department to issue a quarterly report on all vehicles stops. The report would include the number of summonses issued, arrests made, vehicles seized, related use of force incidents, and vehicles searched and whether consent was provided. This information would be disaggregated by precinct, race/ethnicity, and age of the driver.

\v ..Title\par
\v0 A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the police department to report on \cf1 traffic \cf0 encounters\par
\v ..Body\par
\ul\v0\par
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:\ulnone\par
\pard\ltrpar\fi720\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj Section 1. Title 14 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new section 14-191 to read as follows:\par
\ul\'a7 14-191 \cf1 Vehicle\cf0  encounter reports. a. No later than April 30, 2022 and no later than 30 days after the end of each quarter thereafter, the commissioner shall submit to the speaker of the council and the mayor and post on the department\rquote s website a report containing the following information for the previous quarter:\par
1. the total number of \cf1 vehicle stops \cf0 conducted by officers; \par
2. the total number of vehicles stopped by officers at roadblocks or checkpoints except those established due to an emergency, such as a crime scene, fire, building collapse or damage caused by extreme weather conditions or other natural disaster events; \par
3. the total number of summonses issued \cf1 in connection with a vehicle stop, roadblock stop, or checkpoint stop;\cf0\par
4. the total number of arrests made \cf1 in connection with a vehicle stop, roadblock stop, or checkpoint stop;\cf0\par
5. the total number of vehicle stops, roadblock stops, and checkpoint stops;\par
6. the total number of vehicles stopped that were vehicles licensed by the taxi and limousine commission, were cars or sports utility vehicles, and were trucks or busses, motorcycles, or bicycles;\par
7. the total number of summonses issued, disaggregated by whether civil or criminal offenses were charged;\par
8. the total number of arrests made and the top offenses charged; \par
9. the total number of vehicles seized as the result of a vehicle stop, a roadblock or checkpoint; \par
10. the total number of searches of vehicles, disaggregated by whether consent was provided for such searches; and\par
11. total number of use of force incidents, as defined in section 14-158, that occurred in connection with a vehicle stop, a roadblock or checkpoint.\par
b. The information required by subdivision a of this section shall be disaggregated by precinct and the apparent race/ethnicity, gender and age of the driver. \par
c. The information required by this section shall be stored permanently; accessible from the department\rquote s website; and provided in a format that permits automated processing. Each report shall include, once such information is available, a comparison of the current reporting period with reports from the prior four reporting periods.\par
\ulnone\'a7 2. This local law takes effect immediately.\ul\par
